data.text:
@gav424 @KhurettaOmar Argentina will never be a true democracy until it recognizes the Falkland Islanders right to self-determination. You will find that self-determination is now ‘compelling law’
Falklands – Self-Determination (1 pg) : _https://t.co/vOEA0PyYoC

@KhurettaOmar I can only repeat what I said. If argentina had been serious they would have suggested a neutral operator instead of playing politics. Regular flights will resume when the Falklands are ready.
@gav424 Pasen igual si estos no tienen ni binoculares en el ejército . No les verán.

@gav424 Thank you Mr. Short. What about the resumption of the regular flight? Perhaps it would've shown island greatness to accept those charters for the benefit of the people who have been unable to leave the Islands for 2 years. That would have shown the moral high ground of islanders.

@BORIJAV If your government had been sincere instead of cynically trying to get a direct flight to the Falklands they would have suggested a neutral company - as we did. They are the people who are trying to hold fellow South Americans prisoner here. Despicable

@KhurettaOmar Using aerolinas flights into the Falklands in a cynical attempt to get a direct connection. If they were sincere they would have went down the same track as we did - neutral airframe trusted by all.
@gav424 But Mr. Short, didn't Argentina offer two charter flights and resume the regular flight to help those people? (Honest question)
@gav424 La aerolínea “ aerolíneas argentinas” es confiable ya que compran pasajes millones de argentinos.
@gav424 @JustinKuntz1 Is it not possible to bypass Argentina? Fly around the south of Argentine TdF?
@gav424 Honest question: Is it not possible to fly to Chile from the Falkands without entering Argentine airspace?
